commands.description: adds a git remote to an app repo
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku git:remote [34m[flags][39m

[1madds a git remote to an app repo[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mthe Heroku app to use[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mthe git remote to create[22m
 --ssh-git            [2muse SSH git protocol[22m

extra arguments will be passed to git remote add

Examples:

    # set git remote heroku to https://git.heroku.com/example.git
    $ heroku git:remote -a example

    # set git remote heroku-staging to https://git.heroku.com/example-staging.git
    $ heroku git:remote --remote heroku-staging -a example
helpLine: [2madds a git remote to an app repo[22m

commands.description: clones a heroku app to your local machine at DIRECTORY (defaults to app name)
commands.help:
[1mUsage:[22m heroku git:clone [DIRECTORY] [34m[flags][39m

[1mclones a heroku app to your local machine at DIRECTORY (defaults to app name)[22m

DIRECTORY  [2mwhere to clone the app[22m

[34mFlags:[39m
 -a, --app APP        [2mthe Heroku app to use[22m
 -r, --remote REMOTE  [2mthe git remote to create, default "heroku"[22m
 --ssh-git            [2muse SSH git protocol[22m

Examples:

    $ heroku git:clone -a example
    Cloning into 'example'...
    remote: Counting objects: 42, done.
    ...
helpLine: [2mclones a heroku app to your local machine at DIRECTORY (defaults to app name)[22m
